text:
Anti-Abortion Leader Michele Hendrickson to Emcee Maryland’s Annual Pro-Life March in Annapolis - Students for Life of America

 From the SFLA BlogAnti-Abortion Leader Michele Hendrickson to Emcee Maryland’s Annual Pro-Life March in AnnapolisKristi Hamrick - 03 Feb 2022
“Roe v. Wade might be turning 49, but we won’t see it turn 50 as it is,” said Students for Life of America President Kristan Hawkins. “Students for Life of America was founded as a Post-Roe organization, ready to protect life in law and in service in all 50 states. We’ve got a post-Roe plan, and we’re training the next generation of Pro-Life leaders to ensure that the children who will be born will have all our support.”
ANNAPOLIS, M.D., & WASHINGTON, D.C. (02-03-22) – TODAY, less than two week after the 49thanniversary of Roe v. Wade being handed down by the Supreme Court, Maryland will hold its annual statewide pro-life march. Students for Life of America’s Strategic Initiatives Director, Michele Hendrickson, will emcee the event, which takes place at 5pm ET at Lawyer’s Mall in Annapolis. 
Michelle Hendrickson, Students for Life of America’s Strategic Initiatives Director 
“Roe v. Wade might be turning 49,” said Hawkins, “but we won’t see it turn 50 as it is.” She continued: “Students for Life of America was founded as a Post-Roe organization, ready to protect life in law and in service in all 50 states. We’ve got a post-Roe plan, and we’re training the next generation of Pro-Life leaders to ensure that the children who will be born will have all our support.”
The event is organized by Maryland March for Life and supported by Students for of America. SFLA staffers will serve as worship music leaders for the event, guiding participants in prayerful song, and a student leader with SFLA will speak during the event as well. 
Event Time & Location
5pm ET 
Lawyer’s Mall
Annapolis, M.D., 21401
More information HERE and HERE
View a time lapse of the National Pro-Life March HERE
For interviews, contact [email protected]
–30–  
Students for Life Action (SFLAction), a 501c4, along with its 501c3 sister organization, Students for Life of America (SFLA), make up the nation’s largest pro-life youth organization and a political and policy operation engaging people of all ages. Together they work to end abortion — the human rights issue of our day — and provide political, legal, and community support for women and their children, born and preborn. Headquartered in Fredericksburg, VA, SFLA has more than 1,250 groups on middle, high school, college, university, medical, and law school campuses in all 50 states. SFLA creates strategy, policy, and programming to connect those most targeted for abortion with people ready to help and builds a framework for political engagement on their behalf. SFLA and SFLAction have more conversations with those most targeted by the abortion industry than any other pro-life outreach in the world, reaching more than 2 million people across social media platforms each week and engaging in approximately 100,000 digital conversations per month. Over the last 16 years, President Kristan Hawkins has grown SFLAction/SFLA into an $18 million organization preparing for a Post-Roe America.

 Post Views: 1,757
